intro: Dendrobium achillis, commonly known as the golden lip orchid, is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is native to Southeast Asia. It is an epiphytic plant, typically growing on trees or rocks in humid, tropical environments. The plant features a sympodial growth habit, with cane-like stems that produce clusters of showy, yellowish-orange flowers. Its leaves are usually narrow and革质 (leathery), adapted to conserve moisture. The flowers bloom during the dry season, making it a striking addition to gardens and greenhouses.
